page.title: 08SHARLSTON VILLAGE
page.content: Sharlston is about 120 years old,it has a methodist chapel dated 1868.The village outskirts are fields containing crops. The houses there are mainly terraced, one terrace called Long Row has 46 houses joined together continuously. It is the longest row ofterraced houses in britain. In 120 years the village has changed very little, although the roads are now tarmac instead of dirt.The houses now have toilets inside them instead of them being outside.They also have bathrooms, in the past they bathed in a tin bath in front of the fire.Old cooking-ranges have been removed and replaced by coalfires and electric cookers.Sharlston has a friendly atmosphere.Many people meet socially in the "kibble"or working mens club. It's residents think it's the best pit village in Yorkshire.
